clinical_study.brief_title: Study With Palonosetron Alone in Preventing Chemotherapy-induced Nausea and Vomiting in Untreated Patients With Aggressive Non Hodgkin's Lymphomas Who Underwent Moderately Emetogenic Chemotherapy
clinical_study.official_title: Phase II Study With Palonosetron Alone in Preventing Chemotherapy-induced Nausea and Vomiting in Untreated Patients With Aggressive Non Hodgkin's Lymphomas Who Underwent Moderately Emetogenic Chemotherapy

brief_summary.textblock: This is an open-label, multicenter phase II study in patients with aggressive Non Hodgkin Lymphoma scheduled to receive moderately emetogenic polychemotherapy (according to modified Hesketh classification for antiemetic therapy).

primary_outcome.measure: overall rate of patients achieving a complete response (defined as no emetic episode and no use of rescue medication)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: within the first 24 h after chemotherapy and 24-120 h
within the first 24 h after chemotherapy and 24-120 h

secondary_outcome.measure: presence of nausea graded according to Likert scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within the first 24 h after chemotherapy and 24-120 h

secondary_outcome.measure: time to treatment failure (first emetic episode or first need of rescue medication, whichever occurs first)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within the first 24 h after chemotherapy and 24-120 h

secondary_outcome.measure: patient global satisfaction with antiemetic therapy, as measured by a visual analog scale (VAS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within the first 24 h after chemotherapy and 24-120 h
within the first 24 h after chemotherapy and 24-120 h

intervention.description: Palonosetron will be given as an intravenous bolus at the dose of 250 micrograms over 30 seconds beginning 30 minutes before chemotherapy.

clinical_study.keyword: aggressive Non Hodgkin's Lymphomas treated with moderately emetogenic chemotherapy
